home.description: Orthorectify landscape photos using DSM and aerial imagery

project.name: Project Name
project.notFound: Project not found. Please restart from data input.

dataInput.title: Data Input
dataInput.dsmDescription: Select a GeoTIFF format DSM file
dataInput.orthoDescription: Select a GeoTIFF format aerial photo
dataInput.photoDescription: Select the target landscape photo for correction
dataInput.crsMismatchWarning: CRS mismatch between DSM ({dsm_crs}) and Orthophoto ({ortho_crs}). Results may be inaccurate.
dataInput.completeFirst: Please complete the data input step first.

camera.title: Camera Settings
camera.description: Click on the map to set camera position, direction, and field of view. Generate a simulation image and adjust to match the composition of the actual photo.

rendering.title: Rendering Settings
rendering.maxDistanceHint: Maximum distance to render in simulation
rendering.minDistanceHint: Exclude areas too close to camera

matching.title: Image Matching
matching.spatialThinGridHelp: To reduce spatial bias in correspondences, points are thinned at a fixed interval (px).
matching.thresholdHelp: Threshold (px) for fundamental-matrix-based outlier detection. Increase it if correspondences cannot be found near image edges (e.g., with strong lens distortion).

akaze.label: AKAZE
akaze.description: Fast feature detection. Works well when aerial and target images have similar resolution.

sift.label: SIFT
sift.description: Classic and robust method. Accuracy decreases with large resolution differences.

superpoint.label: SuperPoint-LightGlue (Default)
superpoint.description: Deep learning-based matcher (recommended). Robust to viewpoint and resolution changes.

minima.label: MINIMA-ROMA
minima.description: High accuracy but heavy. Requires 16GB+ RAM, processing takes several minutes.

matching.akazeSiftNote: AKAZE/SIFT may fail to detect correspondences when there is a large spatial resolution difference between the aerial and target images.
matching.minimaNote: MINIMA-ROMA is robust and produces dense correspondences but is heavy, requires 16GB+ RAM, and may take several minutes. Image resizing is recommended when using MINIMA-ROMA.

export.title: Export
export.heading: GeoTIFF Export
export.exportNote: Export may take several minutes depending on image size and resolution.

error.missingData: Required input data or camera parameters are missing.
error.noTargetSelected: No estimation targets selected. Please select at least one.

errors.memory_error: Out of memory. Recommended resolution: {resolution}m/pixel or higher
errors.matching_insufficient_points: Insufficient matching points ({count}). At least {required} points required
errors.crs_mismatch_simple: Coordinate reference systems do not match
errors.crs_not_projected: CRS must be a projected coordinate system in meters

help.dsm: Digital Surface Model (GeoTIFF) - Terrain elevation data
help.fov: Field of View - Camera lens viewing angle in degrees
help.pan: Pan angle - Horizontal camera direction in degrees (0° = North, clockwise)
help.tilt: Tilt angle - Vertical camera angle in degrees (0° = horizontal)
help.roll: Roll angle - Camera rotation around optical axis in degrees
help.cameraPosition: Camera position - Shooting location coordinates (projected CRS) and elevation
help.matching_method: Image matching algorithm - Method for detecting corresponding points
help.resolution: Output resolution - Meters per pixel (smaller = higher detail)
help.outputCrs: Output CRS - Coordinate reference system for exported GeoTIFF
help.gcp: GCP (Ground Control Point) - Correspondence between image and geographic coordinates
help.rmse: RMSE (Root Mean Square Error) - Accuracy metric, smaller is better

tooltips.resetParams: Reset camera parameters to default values
tooltips.autoDetect: Auto-detect camera parameters from EXIF data

recovery.title: Unsaved projects found
recovery.description: There are projects from your previous session that were not saved.

estimation.title: Camera Parameter Estimation
estimation.twoStageDescription: First estimates position and orientation, then lens distortion. Effective for lenses with significant distortion.
estimation.twoStageAutoEnabled: Two-stage estimation is automatically enabled when distortion estimation is ON.
estimation.cmaDescription: CMA-ES is slower than Least Squares but performs well when camera position estimation is needed. Two-stage estimation first estimates rough parameters, re-runs image matching, then refines the estimates. Useful when initial camera parameters are uncertain.

cma.label: CMA-ES
cma.description: Evolutionary optimization. Suitable for complex parameter spaces.

lsq.label: Least Squares
lsq.description: Fast local optimization. Effective when initial estimates are good.

gcp.title: Ground Control Points
gcp.noData: No ground control points. Run processing first.
gcp.required: At least 4 GCPs are required for reprocessing.
